The basic population includes the adult Hungarian and Slovak population in southern Slovakia. Multi-stage stratified sampling. At the first stage settlements were categorized based on their ethnic composition. Three types were identified: one with Hungarian majority, the parity type, and the one with Sloval majority. From all three types of settlements a sample was prepared, also considering settlement size. Within the settlements sampling was done using the Leslie Kish method, treating the Hungarians and Slovaks living in the settlement as separate sampling units. In the southern Slovakian sample, representativity according to the demographic data based on census data and the real Hungarian-Slovak ratio was secured by weighing the data.
